intro: Hibbertia woronorana, commonly known as the Grey Box Hibbertia, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its grey-green, leathery leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Hibbertia woronorana is often found in heathlands and woodlands, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for native garden planting.
